page.title: 01The area around Bredfield
page.content: There are four villages in this rural area, Boulge, Debach, Dallinghoo and Bredfield, which is the biggest, having a pub, a primary school, a village hall, a chapel, a church and a shop with a post office. Dallinghoo also has a church, a village hall and a shop with a post office. In the past there were many small mixed farms in the area but now most of the surrounding countryside is used for arable farming as the soil is clay and is good for growing cereal crops. There are different forms of farming as well, three small dairy farms, a battery egg unit and a small pig unit. There are some small woods, which are used for shooting game, mainly pheasant and partridge, scattered around the farms.
